intro: Sauropus lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sauropus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. The leaves are also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
